get.description: Retrieves the version metadata.

post.description: Create a new add-on and add it to the collection of add-ons.

get.description: Retrieves the list of add-ons.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
Order criteria.

The syntax of this parameter is similar to the syntax of the _order by_ clause of
a SQL statement, but using the names of the attributes of the add-on instead of
the names of the columns of a table. For example, in order to sort the add-ons
descending by name the value should be:


```
name desc
```

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then the order of the
results is undefined.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Index of the requested page, where one corresponds to the first page.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
Search criteria.

The syntax of this parameter is similar to the syntax of the _where_ clause of an
SQL statement, but using the names of the attributes of the add-on instead of
the names of the columns of a table. For example, in order to retrieve all the
add-ons with a name starting with `my` the value should be:


```
name like 'my%'
```

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then all the add-ons
that the user has permission to see will be returned.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Maximum number of items that will be contained in the returned page.

page.description: Index of the requested page, where one corresponds to the first page.

size.description: Maximum number of items that will be contained in the returned page.

total.description:
Total number of items of the collection that match the search criteria,
regardless of the size of the page.

The syntax of this parameter is similar to the syntax of the _order by_ clause of
a SQL statement, but using the names of the attributes of the role instead of
the names of the columns of a table. For example, in order to sort the roles

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then the order of the

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Index of the requested page, where one corresponds to the first page.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
Search criteria.

The syntax of this parameter is similar to the syntax of the _where_ clause of an
SQL statement, but using the names of the attributes of the role instead of
the names of the columns of a table. For example, in order to retrieve all the
role with a name starting with `my`the value should be:


```
display_name like 'my%'
```

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then all the roles
that the user has permission to see will be returned.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
Order criteria.

The syntax of this parameter is similar to the syntax of the _order by_ clause of
a SQL statement, but using the names of the attributes of the cloud provider
instead of the names of the columns of a table. For example, in order to sort the
clusters descending by name identifier the value should be:


```
name desc
```

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then the order of the
results is undefined.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Index of the requested page, where one corresponds to the first page.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
Search criteria.

The syntax of this parameter is similar to the syntax of the _where_ clause of a
SQL statement, but using the names of the attributes of the cloud provider
instead of the names of the columns of a table. For example, in order to retrieve
all the cloud providers with a name starting with `A` the value should be:


```
name like 'A%'
```

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then all the clusters
that the user has permission to see will be returned.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Maximum number of items that will be contained in the returned page.

page.description: Index of the requested page, where one corresponds to the first page.

total.description:

regardless of the size of the page.

get.description: Retrieves the details of the cloud provider.

post.description:
Retrieves the list of available regions of the cloud provider.

IMPORTANT: This collection doesn't currently support paging or searching, so the returned
`page` will always be 1 and `size` and `total` will always be the total number of available regions
of the provider.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
Index of the returned page, where one corresponds to the first page. As this
collection doesn't support paging the result will always be `1`.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description:
Number of items that will be contained in the returned page. As this collection
doesn't support paging or searching the result will always be the total number of
regions of the provider.

page.description:
Index of the returned page, where one corresponds to the first page. As this
collection doesn't support paging the result will always be `1`.

size.description:
Number of items that will be contained in the returned page. As this collection
doesn't support paging or searching the result will always be the total number of
regions of the provider.

total.description:
Total number of items of the collection that match the search criteria,
regardless of the size of the page. As this collection doesn't support paging or
searching the result will always be the total number of available regions of the provider.

get.description:
Retrieves the list of regions of the cloud provider.

IMPORTANT: This collection doesn't currently support paging or searching, so the returned
`page` will always be 1 and `size` and `total` will always be the total number of regions
of the provider.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
Index of the returned page, where one corresponds to the first page. As this
collection doesn't support paging the result will always be `1`.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description:
Number of items that will be contained in the returned page. As this collection
doesn't support paging or searching the result will always be the total number of
regions of the provider.

page.description:
Index of the returned page, where one corresponds to the first page. As this
collection doesn't support paging the result will always be `1`.

size.description:
Number of items that will be contained in the returned page. As this collection
doesn't support paging or searching the result will always be the total number of
regions of the provider.

total.description:
Total number of items of the collection that match the search criteria,
regardless of the size of the page. As this collection doesn't support paging or
searching the result will always be the total number of regions of the provider.

get.description: Retrieves the details of the region.

post.description:
Provision a new cluster and add it to the collection of clusters.

See the `register_cluster` method for adding an existing cluster.

get.description: Retrieves the list of clusters.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
Order criteria.

The syntax of this parameter is similar to the syntax of the _order by_ clause of
a SQL statement, but using the names of the attributes of the cluster instead of
the names of the columns of a table. For example, in order to sort the clusters
descending by region identifier the value should be:


```
region.id desc
```

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then the order of the
results is undefined.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Index of the requested page, where one corresponds to the first page.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
Search criteria.

The syntax of this parameter is similar to the syntax of the _where_ clause of a
SQL statement, but using the names of the attributes of the cluster instead of
the names of the columns of a table. For example, in order to retrieve all the
clusters with a name starting with `my` in the `us-east-1` region the value
should be:


```
name like 'my%' and region.id = 'us-east-1'
```

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then all the
clusters that the user has permission to see will be returned.

total.description:
Total number of items of the collection that match the search criteria,
regardless of the size of the page.

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then all the add-on

post.description:
Create a new AWS infrastructure access role grant and add it to the collection of
AWS infrastructure access role grants on the cluster.

get.description: Retrieves the list of AWS infrastructure access role grants.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
Order criteria.

The syntax of this parameter is similar to the syntax of the _order by_ clause of
a SQL statement, but using the names of the attributes of the AWS infrastructure access role grant
instead of the names of the columns of a table. For example, in order to sort the
AWS infrastructure access role grants descending by user ARN the value should be:


```
user_arn desc
```

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then the order of the
results is undefined.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Index of the requested page, where one corresponds to the first page.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
Search criteria.

The syntax of this parameter is similar to the syntax of the _where_ clause of an
SQL statement, but using the names of the attributes of the AWS infrastructure access role grant
instead of the names of the columns of a table. For example, in order to retrieve
all the AWS infrastructure access role grants with a user ARN starting with `user` the value should be:


```
user_arn like '%user'
```

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then all the AWS
infrastructure access role grants that the user has permission to see will be returned.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Line offset to start logs from. if 0 retreive entire log.
If offset > #lines return an empty log.

parameters.name: tail
parameters.description:
Returns the number of tail lines from the end of the log.
If there are no line breaks or the number of lines < tail
return the entire log.
Either 'tail' or 'offset' can be set. Not both.

If there are no line breaks or the number of lines < tail
return the entire log.
Either 'tail' or 'offset' can be set. Not both.

parameters.description:
Order criteria.

The syntax of this parameter is similar to the syntax of the _order by_ clause of
a SQL statement, but using the names of the attributes of the version instead of
the names of the columns of a table. For example, in order to sort the versions
descending by identifier the value should be:


```
id desc
```

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then the order of the
results is undefined.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Index of the requested page, where one corresponds to the first page.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
Search criteria.

The syntax of this parameter is similar to the syntax of the _where_ clause of a
SQL statement, but using the names of the attributes of the version instead of
the names of the columns of a table. For example, in order to retrieve all the
versions that are enabled:


```
enabled = 't'
```

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then all the versions
that the user has permission to see will be returned.

parameters.description:
Maximum number of items that will be contained in the returned page.

Default value is `100`.

Default value is `100`.

AWS.description: _Amazon Web Services_ specific settings of a cluster.

subnet_ids.description: SubnetIDs are the subnet ids to be used when installing the cluster.

AWSFlavour.description: Specification for different classes of nodes inside a flavour.

compute_instance_type.description:
AWS default instance type for the worker volume.

User can be overridden specifying in the cluster itself a type for compute node.

infra_instance_type.description: AWS default instance type for the infra volume.

master_instance_type.description: AWS default instance type for the master volume.

AWSInfrastructureAccessRole.description: A set of acces permissions for AWS resources

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'AWSInfrastructureAccessRole' if this is a complete object or 'AWSInfrastructureAccessRoleLink' if it is just a link.

display_name.description: Human friendly identifier of the role, for example `Read only`.

AWSInfrastructureAccessRoleGrant.description: Representation of an AWS infrastructure access role grant.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'AWSInfrastructureAccessRoleGrant' if this is a complete object or 'AWSInfrastructureAccessRoleGrantLink' if it is just a link.

console_url.description: URL to switch to the role in AWS console.

role.description:
Link to AWS infrastructure access role.
Grant must use a 'valid' role.

state_description.description:
Description of the state.
Will be empty unless state is 'Failed'.

user_arn.description: The user AWS IAM ARN we want to grant the role.

AWSInfrastructureAccessRoleGrantState.description: State of an AWS infrastructure access role grant.

AWSInfrastructureAccessRoleState.description: State of an AWS infrastructure access role.

AWSVolume.description: Holds settings for an AWS storage volume.

size.description: Volume size in Gib.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'CCS' if this is a complete object or 'CCSLink' if it is just a link.

disable_scp_checks.description:
Indicates if cloud permissions checks are disabled,
when attempting installation of the cluster.

enabled.description: Indicates if Customer Cloud Subscription is enabled on the cluster.

CPUTotalNodeRoleOSMetricNode.description: Representation of information from telemetry about a the CPU capacity by node role and OS.

cpu_total.description: The total CPU capacity of nodes with this set of roles and operating system.

node_roles.description: Representation of the node role for a cluster.

CPUTotalsNodeRoleOSMetricNode.description:
Representation of information from telemetry about the CPU capacity by node
role and OS of a cluster.

base_domain.description:
Base DNS domain of the cluster.

During the installation of the cluster it is necessary to create multiple DNS records.
They will be created as sub-domains of this domain. For example, if the name of the
cluster is `mycluster` and the base domain is `example.com` then the following DNS
records will be created:

```
mycluster-api.example.com
mycluster-etcd-0.example.com
mycluster-etcd-1.example.com
mycluster-etcd-3.example.com
```

The exact number, type and names of the created DNS record depends on the characteristics
of the cluster, and may be different for different versions of _OpenShift_. Please don't
rely on them. For example, to find what is the URL of the Kubernetes API server of the
cluster don't assume that it will be `mycluster-api.example.com`. Instead of that use
this API to retrieve the description of the cluster, and get it from the `api.url`
attribute. For example, if the identifier of the cluster is `123` send a request like
this:


```
GET /api/clusters_mgmt/v1/clusters/123 HTTP/1.1
```

That will return a response like this, including the `api.url` attribute:


```
{
    "kind": "Cluster",
    "id": "123",
    "href": "/api/clusters_mgmt/v1/clusters/123",
        "api": {
        "url": "https://mycluster-api.example.com:6443"
    },
    ...
}
```

When the cluster is created in Amazon Web Services it is necessary to create this base
DNS domain in advance, using AWS Route53 (https://console.aws.amazon.com/route53).

GCP.description: Google cloud platform settings of a cluster.

auth_provider_x509_cert_url.description: GCP Authentication provider x509 certificate url

type.description: GCP the type of the service the key belongs to

GCPFlavour.description: Specification for different classes of nodes inside a flavour.

compute_instance_type.description:
GCP default instance type for the worker volume.

User can be overridden specifying in the cluster itself a type for compute node.

infra_instance_type.description: GCP default instance type for the infra volume.

master_instance_type.description: GCP default instance type for the master volume.

password.description: Password to be used in the _HTPasswd_ data file.

username.description: Username to be used in the _HTPasswd_ data file.

LDAPAttributes.description: LDAP attributes used to configure the LDAP identity provider.

id.description: List of attributes to use as the identity.

email.description: List of attributes to use as the mail address.

name.description: List of attributes to use as the display name.

preferred_username.description: List of attributes to use as the preferred user name when provisioning a user.

ca.description: Certificate bundle to use to validate server certificates for the configured URL.

url.description:
An https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2255[RFC 2255] URL which specifies the LDAP host and
search parameters to use.

attributes.description: LDAP attributes used to configure the provider.

bind_dn.description: Optional distinguished name to use to bind during the search phase.

bind_password.description: Optional password to use to bind during the search phase.

insecure.description:
When `true` no TLS connection is made to the server. When `false` `ldaps://...` URLs
connect using TLS and `ldap://...` are upgraded to TLS.

SSHCredentials.description: SSH key pair of a cluster.

private_key.description: SSH private key of the cluster.

public_key.description: SSH public key of the cluster.

AddOn.description: Representation of an add-on that can be installed in a cluster.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'AddOn' if this is a complete object or 'AddOnLink' if it is just a link.

docs_link.description: Link to documentation about the add-on.

enabled.description: Indicates if this add-on can be added to clusters.

has_external_resources.description: Indicates if this add-on has external resources associated with it

hidden.description: Indicates if this add-on is hidden.

icon.description: Base64-encoded icon representing an add-on. The icon should be in PNG format.

install_mode.description: The mode in which the addon is deployed.

label.description: Label used to attach to a cluster deployment when add-on is installed.

operator_name.description: The name of the operator installed by this add-on.

parameters.description: List of parameters for this add-on.

resource_cost.description: Used to determine how many units of quota an add-on consumes per resource name.

resource_name.description: Used to determine from where to reserve quota for this add-on.

target_namespace.description: The namespace in which the addon CRD exists.

AddOnInstallMode.description: Representation of an add-on InstallMode field.

AddOnInstallation.description: Representation of an add-on installation in a cluster.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'AddOnInstallation' if this is a complete object or 'AddOnInstallationLink' if it is just a link.

addon.description: Link to add-on attached to this cluster.

cluster.description: ID used to identify the cluster that this add-on is attached to.

creation_timestamp.description: Date and time when the add-on was initially installed in the cluster.

operator_version.description: Version of the operator installed by the add-on.

parameters.description: List of add-on parameters for this add-on installation.

state.description: Overall state of the add-on installation.

updated_timestamp.description: Date and time when the add-on installation information was last updated.

AddOnInstallationParameter.description: Representation of an add-on installation parameter.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'AddOnInstallationParameter' if this is a complete object or 'AddOnInstallationParameterLink' if it is just a link.

AddOnInstallationState.description: Representation of an add-on installation State field.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'AddOnParameter' if this is a complete object or 'AddOnParameterLink' if it is just a link.

editable.description: Indicates if this parameter can be edited after creation.

enabled.description: Indicates if this parameter is enabled for the add-on.

required.description: Indicates if this parameter is required by the add-on.

validation.description: Validation rule for the add-on parameter.

value_type.description: Type of value of the add-on parameter.

AdminCredentials.description:
Temporary administrator credentials generated during the installation of the
cluster.

AlertInfo.description: Provides information about a single alert firing on the cluster.

name.description: The alert name. Multiple alerts with same name are possible.

AlertSeverity.description: Severity of a cluster alert received via telemetry.

AlertsInfo.description: Provides information about the alerts firing on the cluster.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'CloudProvider' if this is a complete object or 'CloudProviderLink' if it is just a link.

display_name.description:
Name of the cloud provider for display purposes. It can contain any characters,
including spaces.

name.description: Human friendly identifier of the cloud provider, for example `aws`.

CloudRegion.description: Description of a region of a cloud provider.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'CloudRegion' if this is a complete object or 'CloudRegionLink' if it is just a link.

cloud_provider.description: Link to the cloud provider that the region belongs to.

display_name.description: Name of the region for display purposes, for example `N. Virginia`.

enabled.description: Whether the region is enabled for deploying an OSD cluster.

name.description:
Human friendly identifier of the region, for example `us-east-1`.

NOTE: Currently for all cloud providers and all regions `id` and `name` have exactly
the same values.

supports_multi_az.description: Whether the region supports multiple availability zones.

Cluster.description:
Definition of an _OpenShift_ cluster.

The `cloud_provider` attribute is a reference to the cloud provider. When a
cluster is retrieved it will be a link to the cloud provider, containing only
the kind, id and href attributes:


```
{
  "cloud_provider": {
    "kind": "CloudProviderLink",
    "id": "123",
    "href": "/api/clusters_mgmt/v1/cloud_providers/123"
  }
}
```

When a cluster is created this is optional, and if used it should contain the
identifier of the cloud provider to use:


```
{
  "cloud_provider": {
    "id": "123",
  }
}
```

If not included, then the cluster will be created using the default cloud
provider, which is currently Amazon Web Services.

The region attribute is mandatory when a cluster is created.

The `aws.access_key_id`, `aws.secret_access_key` and `dns.base_domain`
attributes are mandatory when creation a cluster with your own Amazon Web
Services account.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'Cluster' if this is a complete object or 'ClusterLink' if it is just a link.

api.description: Information about the API of the cluster.

aws.description: Amazon Web Services settings of the cluster.

aws_infrastructure_access_role_grants.description: List of AWS infrastructure access role grants on this cluster.

ccs.description: Contains configuration of a Customer Cloud Subscription cluster.

gcp.description: Google cloud platform settings of the cluster.

addons.description: List of add-ons on this cluster.

cloud_provider.description: Link to the cloud provider where the cluster is installed.

cluster_admin_enabled.description: Flag indicating if cluster-admin access is enabled.

console.description: Information about the console of the cluster.

creation_timestamp.description:
Date and time when the cluster was initially created, using the
format defined in https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt[RC3339].

display_name.description:
Name of the cluster for display purposes. It can contain any
characters, including spaces.

expiration_timestamp.description:
Date and time when the cluster will be automatically deleted, using the format defined in
https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt[RFC3339]. If no timestamp is provided, the cluster
will never expire.

This option is unsupported.

external_id.description: External identifier of the cluster, generated by the installer.

external_configuration.description: ExternalConfiguration shows external configuration on the cluster.

flavour.description: Link to the _flavour_ that was used to create the cluster.

groups.description: Link to the collection of groups of user of the cluster.

health_state.description: HealthState indicates the overall health state of the cluster.

identity_providers.description: Link to the collection of identity providers of the cluster.

ingresses.description: List of ingresses on this cluster.

load_balancer_quota.description: Load Balancer quota to be assigned to the cluster.

machine_pools.description: List of machine pools on this cluster.

managed.description:
Flag indicating if the cluster is managed (by Red Hat) or
self-managed by the user.

metrics.description:
Cluster metrics received from telemetry.

When provisioning a cluster this will be ignored.

multi_az.description:
Flag indicating if the cluster should be created with nodes in
different availability zones or all the nodes in a single one
randomly selected.

name.description:
Name of the cluster. This name is assigned by the user when the
cluster is created.

nodes.description: Information about the nodes of the cluster.

openshift_version.description:
Version of _OpenShift_ installed in the cluster, for example `4.0.0-0.2`.

When retrieving a cluster this will always be reported.

When provisioning a cluster this will be ignored, as the version to
deploy will be determined internally.

product.description: Link to the product type of this cluster.

properties.description: User defined properties for tagging and querying.

provision_shard.description: ProvisionShard contains the properties of the provision shard, including AWS and GCP related configurations

region.description: Link to the cloud provider region where the cluster is installed.

storage_quota.description: Storage quota to be assigned to the cluster.

subscription.description:
Link to the subscription that comes from the account management service when the cluster
is registered.

version.description: Link to the version of _OpenShift_ that will be used to install the cluster.

ClusterAPI.description: Information about the API of a cluster.

url.description: The URL of the API server of the cluster.

listening.description: The listening method of the API server.

ClusterConsole.description: Information about the console of a cluster.

url.description: The URL of the console of the cluster.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'ClusterCredentials' if this is a complete object or 'ClusterCredentialsLink' if it is just a link.

ssh.description: SSH key pair of the cluster.

admin.description:
Temporary administrator credentials generated during the installation
of the cluster.

ClusterHealthState.description: ClusterHealthState indicates the health of a cluster.

ClusterMetric.description:
Metric describing the total and used amount of some resource (like RAM, CPU and storage) in
a cluster.

total.description:
Total amount of the resource that exists in the cluster. For example the total amount
of RAM.

used.description:
Amount of the resource that is currently in use in the cluster. Fore example the amount
of RAM in use.

cpu.description: The amount of CPU provisioned and used in the cluster.

compute_nodes_cpu.description: The amount of CPU provisioned and used in the cluster by compute nodes.

compute_nodes_memory.description: The amount of memory provisioned and used in the cluster by compute nodes.

compute_nodes_sockets.description: The amount of sockets provisioned and used in the cluster by compute nodes.

critical_alerts_firing.description: CriticalAlertsFiring contains information about critical alerts firing.

memory.description: The amount of memory provisioned and used in the cluster.

nodes.description: The number of nodes provisioned for the cluster.

operators_condition_failing.description: OperatorsConditionFailing contains information about operator in failing condition in the cluster.

sockets.description: The amount of sockets provisioned and used in the cluster.

storage.description:
The amount of storage provisioned and used in the cluster.

WARNING: This isn't currently populated.

ClusterNodes.description: Counts of different classes of nodes inside a cluster.

autoscale_compute.description:
Details for auto-scaling the compute machine pool.
Compute and AutoscaleCompute cannot be used together.

availability_zones.description: The availability zones upon which the nodes are created.

compute.description:
Number of compute nodes of the cluster.
Compute and AutoscaleCompute cannot be used together.

compute_labels.description: The labels set on the "default" compute machine pool.

compute_machine_type.description: The compute machine type to use, for example `r5.xlarge`.

infra.description: Number of infrastructure nodes of the cluster.

master.description: Number of master nodes of the cluster.

total.description: Total number of nodes of the cluster.

condition.description: Operator status.  Empty string if unknown.

reason.description: Extra detail on condition, if available.  Empty string if unknown.

time.description: Time when the sample was obtained, in [RFC3339](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt) format.

version.description: Current version of the operator.  Empty string if unknown.

ClusterOperatorState.description: Overall state of a cluster operator.

ClusterOperatorsInfo.description: Provides detailed information about the operators installed on the cluster.

ClusterRegistration.description: Registration of a new cluster to the service.

external_id.description:
Identifier of the cluster generated by the installer.

For example, to register a cluster that has been provisioned outside
of this service, send a a request like this:


```
POST /api/clusters_mgmt/v1/register_cluster HTTP/1.1
```

With a request body like this:


```
{
  "external_id": "d656aecf-11a6-4782-ad86-8f72638449ba"
}
```

organization_id.description:
Optional Organization identifier of the cluster generated by the
account manager.

subscription_id.description:
Subscription identifier of the cluster generated by the account
manager.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'ClusterStatus' if this is a complete object or 'ClusterStatusLink' if it is just a link.

description.description: Detailed description of the cluster status.

state.description: The overall state of the cluster.

Dashboard.description: Collection of metrics intended to render a graphical dashboard.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'Dashboard' if this is a complete object or 'DashboardLink' if it is just a link.

labels.description: list of labels externally configured on the clusterdeployment.

syncsets.description: list of syncsets externally configured on the cluster.

Flavour.description:
Set of predefined properties of a cluster. For example, a _huge_ flavour can be a cluster
with 10 infra nodes and 1000 compute nodes.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'Flavour' if this is a complete object or 'FlavourLink' if it is just a link.

aws.description: Default _Amazon Web Services_ settings of the cluster.

gcp.description: Default _Google Cloud Platform_ settings of the cluster.

name.description:
Human friendly identifier of the cluster, for example `4`.

NOTE: Currently for all flavours the `id` and `name` attributes have exactly the
same values.

network.description:
Default network settings of the cluster.

These can be overridden specifying in the cluster itself a different set of settings.

nodes.description:
Number of nodes that will be used by default when creating a cluster that uses
this flavour.

These can be overridden specifying in the cluster itself a different number of nodes.

FlavourNodes.description: Counts of different classes of nodes inside a flavour.

master.description: Number of master nodes of the cluster.

ca.description: Optional trusted certificate authority bundle to use when making requests tot he server.

client_id.description: Client identifier of a registered _GitHub_ OAuth application.

client_secret.description: Client secret of a registered _GitHub_ OAuth application.

hostname.description:
For _GitHub Enterprise_ you must provide the host name of your instance, such as
`example.com`. This value must match the _GitHub Enterprise_ host name value in the
`/setup/settings` file and cannot include a port number.

For plain _GitHub_ omit this parameter.

organizations.description: Optional list of organizations. Cannot be used in combination with the Teams field.

teams.description: Optional list of teams. Cannot be used in combination with the Organizations field.

ca.description: Optional trusted certificate authority bundle to use when making requests tot he server.

client_id.description: Client identifier of a registered _GitLab_ OAuth application.
Client identifier of a registered _Google_ project.

hosted_domain.description: Optional hosted domain to restrict sign-in accounts to.

Group.description: Representation of a group of users.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'Group' if this is a complete object or 'GroupLink' if it is just a link.

users.description: List of users of the group.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'IdentityProvider' if this is a complete object or 'IdentityProviderLink' if it is just a link.

challenge.description:
When `true` unauthenticated token requests from non-web clients (like the CLI) are sent a
`WWW-Authenticate` challenge header for this provider.

login.description:
When `true` unauthenticated token requests from web clients (like the web console) are
redirected to the authorize URL to log in.

mapping_method.description:
Controls how mappings are established between this provider's identities and user
objects.

name.description: The name of the identity provider.

type.description:
Type of identity provider. The rest of the attributes will be populated according to this
value. For example, if the type is `github` then only the `github` attribute will be
populated.

IdentityProviderMappingMethod.description: Controls how mappings are established between provider identities and user objects.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'Ingress' if this is a complete object or 'IngressLink' if it is just a link.

cluster.description: ID used to identify the cluster that this ingress is attached to.

default.description: Indicates if this is the default ingress.

route_selectors.description: A set of labels for the ingress.

Label.description: Representation of a label in clusterdeployment.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'Label' if this is a complete object or 'LabelLink' if it is just a link.

value.description: the value to set in the label

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'Log' if this is a complete object or 'LogLink' if it is just a link.

MachinePool.description: Representation of a machine pool in a cluster.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'MachinePool' if this is a complete object or 'MachinePoolLink' if it is just a link.

autoscaling.description:
Details for auto-scaling the machine pool.
Replicas and autoscaling cannot be used together.

availability_zones.description: The availability zones upon which the nodes are created.

cluster.description: ID used to identify the cluster that this machinepool is attached to.

instance_type.description: The instance type of Nodes to create.

labels.description: The labels set on the Nodes created.

replicas.description:
The number of Machines (and Nodes) to create.
Replicas and autoscaling cannot be used together.

taints.description: The taints set on the Nodes created.

MachinePoolAutoscaling.description: Representation of a autoscaling in a machine pool.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'MachinePoolAutoscaling' if this is a complete object or 'MachinePoolAutoscalingLink' if it is just a link.

max_replicas.description: The maximum number of replicas for the machine pool.

min_replicas.description: The minimum number of replicas for the machine pool.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'MachineType' if this is a complete object or 'MachineTypeLink' if it is just a link.

cpu.description: The amount of cpu's of the machine type.

category.description: The category which the machine type is suitable for.

cloud_provider.description: Link to the cloud provider that the machine type belongs to.

memory.description: The amount of memory of the machine type.

name.description: Human friendly identifier of the machine type, for example `r5.xlarge - Memory Optimized`.

size.description: The size of the machine type.

host_prefix.description: Network host prefix which is defaulted to `23` if not specified.

machine_cidr.description: IP address block from which to assign machine IP addresses, for example `10.0.0.0/16`.

pod_cidr.description: IP address block from which to assign pod IP addresses, for example `10.128.0.0/14`.

service_cidr.description: IP address block from which to assign service IP addresses, for example `172.30.0.0/16`.

NodeInfo.description: Provides information about a node from specific type in the cluster.

amount.description: The amount of the nodes from this type.

NodeType.description: Type of node received via telemetry.

NodesInfo.description: Provides information about the nodes in the cluster.

email.description: List of claims to use as the mail address.

name.description: List of claims to use as the display name.

preferred_username.description: List of claims to use as the preferred user name when provisioning a user.

ca.description: Certificate bunde to use to validate server certificates for the configured URL.

claims.description: Claims used to configure the provider.

client_id.description: Identifier of a client registered with the _OpenID_ provider.

extra_authorize_parameters.description: Optional map of extra parameters to add to the authorization token request.

extra_scopes.description:
Optional list of scopes to request, in addition to the `openid` scope, during the
authorization token request.

issuer.description: The URL that the OpenID Provider asserts as the Issuer Identifier

Product.description: Representation of an product that can be selected as a cluster type.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'Product' if this is a complete object or 'ProductLink' if it is just a link.

ProvisionShard.description: Contains the properties of the provision shard, including AWS and GCP related configurations

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'ProvisionShard' if this is a complete object or 'ProvisionShardLink' if it is just a link.

aws_account_operator_config.description: Contains the configuration for the AWS account operator

gcp_project_operator.description: Contains the configuration for the GCP project operator

time.description: Time when the sample was obtained.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'ServerConfig' if this is a complete object or 'ServerConfigLink' if it is just a link.

SocketTotalNodeRoleOSMetricNode.description:
Representation of information from telemetry about a the socket capacity
by node role and OS.

node_roles.description: Representation of the node role for a cluster.

socket_total.description: The total socket capacity of nodes with this set of roles and operating system.

SocketTotalsNodeRoleOSMetricNode.description:
Representation of information from telemetry about the socket capacity by node
role and OS of a cluster.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'Subscription' if this is a complete object or 'SubscriptionLink' if it is just a link.
Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'Syncset' if this is a complete object or 'SyncsetLink' if it is just a link.

resources.description: List of k8s objects to configure for the cluster.

Taint.description: Representation of a Taint set on a MachinePool in a cluster.

effect.description: The effect on the node for the pods matching the taint, i.e: NoSchedule, NoExecute, PreferNoSchedule.

UpgradePolicy.description: Representation of an upgrade policy that can be set for a cluster.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'UpgradePolicy' if this is a complete object or 'UpgradePolicyLink' if it is just a link.

cluster_id.description: Cluster ID this upgrade policy is defined for.

next_run.description: Next time the upgrade should run.

schedule.description: Schedule cron expression that defines automatic upgrade scheduling.

schedule_type.description: Schedule type can be either "manual" (single execution) or "automatic" (re-occurring).

upgrade_type.description: Upgrade type specify the type of the upgrade. Can be "OSD" or "CVE".

version.description: Version is the desired upgrade version.

UpgradePolicyState.description: Representation of an upgrade policy state that that is set for a cluster.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'UpgradePolicyState' if this is a complete object or 'UpgradePolicyStateLink' if it is just a link.
Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'User' if this is a complete object or 'UserLink' if it is just a link.

Value.description:
Numeric value and the unit used to measure it.

Units are not mandatory, and they're not specified for some resources. For
resources that use bytes, the accepted units are:

- 1 B = 1 byte
- 1 KB = 10^3 bytes
- 1 MB = 10^6 bytes
- 1 GB = 10^9 bytes
- 1 TB = 10^12 bytes
- 1 PB = 10^15 bytes

- 1 B = 1 byte
- 1 KiB = 2^10 bytes
- 1 MiB = 2^20 bytes
- 1 GiB = 2^30 bytes
- 1 TiB = 2^40 bytes
- 1 PiB = 2^50 bytes

unit.description: Name of the unit used to measure the value.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'Version' if this is a complete object or 'VersionLink' if it is just a link.

rosa_enabled.description: ROSAEnabled indicates whether this version can be used to create ROSA clusters.

available_upgrades.description: AvailableUpgrades is the list of versions this version can be upgraded to.

channel_group.description:
ChannelGroup is the name of the group where this image belongs.
ChannelGroup is a mechanism to partition the images to different groups,
each image belongs to only a single group.

default.description:
Indicates if this should be selected as the default version when a cluster is created
without specifying explicitly the version.

enabled.description: Indicates if this version can be used to create clusters.

raw_id.description: RawID is the id of the version - without channel group and prefix.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will always be 'Error'

code.description: Globally unique code of the error, composed of the unique identifier of the API and the numeric identifier of the error. For example, for if the numeric identifier of the error is `93` and the identifier of the API is `clusters_mgmt` then the code will be `CLUSTERS-MGMT-93`.

reason.description: Human readable description of the error.
